news-item.title: NRHC notice to TN CS
news-item.text: Chennai, March 24 -- Expressing concern over alleged serious issue of violation of human rights,the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to the Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary calling for report within four weeks into deaths of seven workers of a private dyeing unit in Erode District on March 18. Taking suo motu cognizance of media reports that seven workers of a private dyeing unit located in the Erode Industrial Complex of State Industries Promotion Corporation of Tamil Nadu died of asphyxiation and several others taken ill on March 18, 2014 after inhaling toxic gas from a waste treatment tank, the NHRC issued the notice to the Chief Secretary. A NHRC release said reportedly, the incident took place when a mechanic went inside the tank to work on a faulty pump but he fell as he was climbing down. Others followed him for his rescue and fell prey to the toxic gas, the release added. The Commission had observed that the contents of the report, if true, raise a serious issue of violation of human rights of the victims and issued the notice to the Chief Secretary calling for report within four weeks. He has also been directed to inform whether any interim relief has been provided to the next of kin of the deceased workers,the release added.
